title: Pro Take: Revlon Stock Rally Could Be a Terrible Thing To Waste
sub_head: Retail investors don’t need the regulator to determine whether Revlon, or any other struggling company, is a good investment or not
body:
A curious thing happened in U.S. equity markets last week. Revlon Inc.’s stock rose when it should have tanked after the company declared bankruptcy. Which could pose an awkward question for the Securities and Exchange Commission: Should a company be allowed to sell shares as it restructures just because it can?
The SEC considered that question in 2020, when bankrupt Hertz Global Holdings Inc. tried to capitalize on a sudden rally in its stock by selling new equity. The answer from the SEC was “no,” and Hertz was thwarted...
